lines.text: Enter CASSIO and some Musicians

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Masters, play here I will content your pains Something thats brief and bid Good morrow, general.
Music
Enter Clown

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Why masters, have your instruments been in Naples, that they speak i the nose thus

lines.speaker: first musician
lines.text: How, sir, how!

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Are these, I pray you, windinstruments

lines.speaker: first musician
lines.text: Ay, marry, are they, sir.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: O, thereby hangs a tail.

lines.speaker: first musician
lines.text: Whereby hangs a tale, sir

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Marry. sir, by many a windinstrument that I know. But, masters, heres money for you: and the general so likes your music, that he desires you, for loves sake, to make no more noise with it.

lines.speaker: first musician
lines.text: Well, sir, we will not.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: If you have any music that may not be heard, tot again: but, as they say to hear music the general does not greatly care.

lines.speaker: first musician
lines.text: We have none such, sir.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Then put up your pipes in your bag, for Ill away: go vanish into air away!
Exeunt Musicians

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Dost thou hear, my honest friend

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: No, I hear not your honest friend I hear you.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Prithee, keep up thy quillets. Theres a poor piece of gold for thee: if the gentlewoman that attends the generals wife be stirring, tell her theres one Cassio entreats her a little favour of speech: wilt thou do this

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: She is stirring, sir: if she will stir hither, I shall seem to notify unto her.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Do, good my friend. In happy time, Iago.
Exit Clown
Enter IAGO

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: You have not been abed, then

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Why, no the day had broke Before we parted. I have made bold, Iago, To send in to your wife: my suit to her Is, that she will to virtuous Desdemona Procure me some access.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Ill send her to you presently And Ill devise a mean to draw the Moor Out of the way, that your converse and business May be more free.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I humbly thank you fort. I never knew A Florentine more kind and honest.
Exit IAGO
Enter EMILIA

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Good morrow, good Lieutenant: I am sorry For your displeasure but all will sure be well. The general and his wife are talking of it And she speaks for you stoutly: the Moor replies, That he you hurt is of great fame in Cyprus, And great affinity, and that in wholesome wisdom He might not but refuse you but he protests he loves you And needs no other suitor but his likings To take the safest occasion by the front To bring you in again.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Yet, I beseech you, If you think fit, or that it may be done, Give me advantage of some brief discourse With Desdemona alone.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Pray you, come in I will bestow you where you shall have time To speak your bosom freely.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I am much bound to you.
Exeunt
